title: Opposition leader faces worst polling in 20 years | 7NEWS
description: The latest news poll shows the opposition leader has become the most unpopular major party leader since 2003, with the Liberal and National Party's combined support falling to 18% while One Nation surges to 27%. Senior conservatives believe these results may trigger a leadership challenge from Angus Taylor later in the week. Susan Lee recently reunited the coalition with David Littleproud after a 17-day split, compromising on a six-week punishment for three national senators who breached shadow cabinet solidarity.
